entry.title: [Passwords] Exclude 1-symbol name inputs from single username flows
entry.content:
Currently, Password Manager does not consider nameless fields for

UFF voting, because a single nameless text field can be anything, and

is likely to cause aggregation of many unrelated fields on the server.

However, 1-symbol long inputs are also not meaningful, and cause the

same problems.



This CL:

1) Extends the voting check in the renderer to also ignore 1-symbol

long field names.

2) Adds the same check in the form parser to ignore the existing

predictions for such fields.



Bug: b/329847725

Change-Id: Ib7b90207e4a661a4c87b85a1bd81ec85a048135b

entry.title: Reland "ozone/drm: Retry test modesets w/ all possible CRTC-connector permutations"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 1846ac9e49f1d034c546fa11534319415a9bbaac



Disable certain tests in LSAN build that leak DrmDevice due to cyclic

dependency. Refer to b/40263526 for more details on the cyclic

dependency.



Original change's description:

> ozone/drm: Retry test modesets w/ all possible CRTC-connector permutations

>

> The kernel sometimes uses multiple CRTCs for a single connector without

> marking the CRTC as in use to userspace. One such case is when

> Bigjoiner (an intel driver feature) takes an additional CRTC for high

> bandwidth modes. Modesetting with a stolen CRTC will result in failure.

> The only way to work around additional CRTCs being taken is to test

> modeset on various CRTC-connector permutations, and to use the

> permutation that doesn’t fail.

>

> This CL adds a fallback logic on test modeset failure.

> The fallback logic generates all possible permutations of

> CRTC-connector pairings given each connectors’ possible CRTCs, and

> tries to test modeset on all of them. The fallback will immediately

> terminate upon the first test modeset success.

>

> Ozone will revert any changes to its abstractions that were made during

> the fallback attempts, such that the original CRTC-connector pairings

> before the configure request are maintained. Maintaining the original

> pairings is necessary as pageflips with old display state might

> interleave the UI's fallback test modesets. GetNativeDisplays()

> attempts to maintain stability of CRTC-connector pairings whenever

> possible, which leads to dramatically decreased chances of pageflip

> failure (which results in GPU process crash).

>

> high-bandwidth display

>

> Bug: b:322831691, b:303194009

> Test: ozone_unittests && display_unittests && manual testing w/

> Change-Id: I3c747032067b2d4a2d8ab8974f59d7d2dbe53c65

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5301492

> Commit-Queue: Su Hong Koo

> Reviewed-by: Gil Dekel

> Reviewed-by: Mark PMNKHME

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1272971}



Bug: b:322831691, b:303194009

Change-Id: I886ae033cb5dd3f604e7576e6b3ddc590730fb16

entry.title: CCA: Implement ScreenLockedMonitor for CCA to monitor screen lock state
entry.content:
Since idleDetector polls screen lock state every 15 seconds now, it may

causes a privacy issue if CCA relies on it to start/stop capture. This

CL implements ScreenLockedMonitor for CCA to monitor screen lock state.

With it, CCA can start/stop capture with no delay when the lock state of

screen is changed.



Bug: b:329191613

entry.title: android: Propagate Window.getDecorView() to the native InputHintChecker
entry.content:
In ChromeActivity.onResumeWithNative() grab a weak reference to

getWindow().getDecorView() and set it for the native InputHintChecker to

use later. The InputHintChecker will need to be initialized before

HasInput() can access the hint on that View. Async initialization will

land separately.



It is important that we propagate the result of getDecorView() because

it is a root view that can reach out to the corresponding InputChannel

(the Android-side abstraction).



Disable input hint checking when in multi-window mode for simplicity.

Walking through Views for each of the visible windows would need a more

sophisticated latency/overhead tradeoff investigation.



Bug: 326417367

Change-Id: I8552e078a4b40855908c70171472a6b42d687a8e

entry.title: Prepare to convert SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/components/safe_browsing/content/browser', '/components/safe_browsing']
entry.content:
It's somewhat difficult to log an SBThreatType as an UMA histogram since

we don't have a kMaxValue. We can't simply add a kMaxValue because

SBThreatType is an enum instead of enum class, and we'd be exposing a

constant safe_browsing::kMaxValue. This CL prepares to convert

SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/components/safe_browsing/content/browser', '/components/safe_browsing'].



That requires two changes:



- SBThreatType is no longer implicitly convertible to int, so we will

need a few static casts



- SBThreatType values are now in the namespace

safe_browsing::SBThreatType instead of just safe_browsing. In some

places this is fixed by adding the new namespace, and in some places

with a "using enum" declaration. We can't just add a "using enum" for

all usages of SBThreatType because "using enum" would declare a

constant kMaxValue. So "using enum" is only used when many

SBThreatType constants are used, and in as narrow a scope as possible.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Make kPersonallyIdentifiableStatusFields a constexpr variable
entry.content:
This was actually being initialized at runtime, since the initializer

was not a constant expression. base::MakeFixedFlatMap is stricter and

requiring consteval, so fixing this consists of two parts:

- marking `kPersonallyIdentifiableStatusFields` itself as constexpr

- making all the policy keys constexpr



The latter has some implications in component builds: specifically, it

is possible for the constants to be built into multiple discrete

components, breaking things that rely on pointer identity. This

dependency does not seem to be there in practice, and Chrome should

prioritize optimizing for production builds that ship to users over

developer-only component builds.



This also changes a use of base::StringPiece to std::string_view.

entry.title: [ios] Handle absence of account permanent bookmark folders
entry.content:
Behavioral changes only behind disabled feature flag.



When `syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage` is enabled,

account permanent folders are supported via dedicated functions in

BookmarkModel API, such as `BookmarkModel::account_mobile_node()`.



These APIs can return null and transitioning from and to null is

notified to observers via folder creation and removal. In this patch,

several of these codepaths are fixed, as surfaced by EG tests when

attempting to enable the feature in bots.

entry.title: [PolicyLogs] Fix PolicyLoggerTest.PolicyLoggingEnabled Flakines
entry.content:
The `PolicyLoggingEnabled` test is flaky on bots because the logger size

is 200 before the test runs, and the logger size is limited to 200. If

the limit is reached, the oldest log is deleted before adding a new one.

Other tests might be running before the PolicyLoggerTest and filling

the logger to the limit, so the logger is now reset in `SetUp` instead

of `TearDown` to make sure its size is 0 at the beginning of tests.

entry.title: Add build-dir and target args to web_tests' generated test script
entry.content:
As-is, if you use web_tests' generated wrapper script locally in a

non-standard build dir (ie: anything not named "Release" or "Debug")

and don't pass in special args, the suite will fail with errors like:

"""

Unable to find test driver at ${PATH_TO_CHECKOUT}/out/Release/content_shell

"""



This is because web_tests' harness needs to be passed the build dir

via "--build-directory" and "--target" args. And if they're not passed,

it defaults to trying simply "Release" or "Debug". Which then leads

to failures when that doesn't match the actual name of the current

build dir.



So this binds the current build dir in the generated wrapper script's

args for convenience. Note that we need to split it into two parts:

"--build-directory" for the relative path minus the last dir, and

"--target" for the last dir. Should be safe for build dirs several

levels under //out/ (eg: //out/a/b/c/d/e/). Though likely not safe for

anyone that builds in a dir only one deep from the repo root (eg:

right inside //out/). But it's prob not the only thing that breaks

in that case?

entry.title: Prepare to convert SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/ios/chrome/browser/webui/ui_bundled', '/ios/web_view']
entry.content:
It's somewhat difficult to log an SBThreatType as an UMA histogram since

we don't have a kMaxValue. We can't simply add a kMaxValue because

SBThreatType is an enum instead of enum class, and we'd be exposing a

constant safe_browsing::kMaxValue. This CL prepares to convert

SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/ios/chrome/browser/webui/ui_bundled', '/ios/web_view'].



That requires two changes:



- SBThreatType is no longer implicitly convertible to int, so we will

need a few static casts



- SBThreatType values are now in the namespace

safe_browsing::SBThreatType instead of just safe_browsing. In some

places this is fixed by adding the new namespace, and in some places

with a "using enum" declaration. We can't just add a "using enum" for

all usages of SBThreatType because "using enum" would declare a

constant kMaxValue. So "using enum" is only used when many

SBThreatType constants are used, and in as narrow a scope as possible.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



Bug: 329698341

entry.content:
CrashesDOMHandler contains logic to check whether the signed-in account

is an @google.com account.

Before this CL, that check required ConsentLevel::kSync, i.e. for the

user to have enabled Sync-the-feature.

This is just an historic artifact; there's no need for this check to

depend on Sync-the-feature.

So this CL changes this to ConsentLevel::kSignin.

entry.title: [UPM] Split PasswordSyncControllerDelegate
entry.content:
This CL extracts logic relevant for the `ModelTypeControllerDelegate`

to the new class and uses it to get `ProxyModelTypeControllerDelegate`

in `PasswordStoreAndroidAccountBackend`. There should be no behavioural

changes and this CL is purely refactoring that's needed for the

followup.



In the followup CL an existing flag

`kUnifiedPasswordManagerSyncUsingAndroidBackendOnly` will be removed

and all backends that used it previously will call

`CreateSyncControllerDelegate()` on the active backend directly. Then

the `PasswordStoreBuiltInBackend` will check for the

`kUnifiedPasswordManagerSyncOnlyInGMSCore` flag and if it is enabled

the new `PasswordModelTypeControllerDelegate` will be returned. Thus

sync events will be ignored. If the flag was disabled, the existing

implementation will be used.

entry.title: Remove the colors param in UpdateSystemColorInfo() pipeline
entry.content:
This CL begins the cleaning up of the UpdateSystemColorInfo() pipeline

by removing the colors parameter. Originally, this pipeline was

designed to enable the LayoutTheme retrieve system colors from the

NativeTheme. However, as system colors are now retrieved through color

providers in Blink, the colors parameter has become redundant and

therefore can be removed.



Next steps will involve removing the `is_dark_mode` and `forced_colors`

parameters. This will be carried out following the ongoing efforts to

make forced colors state in Blink a web setting, as initiated in

CL:5324688.

entry.title: [ios] Migrate prefs if bookmark IDs are reassigned
entry.content:
Reassigning bookmark node IDs when loading a JSON file is generally rare

and supported best-effort, but on iOS specifically there is a common

one-off case as a result of feature

`syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage` rolling out.



In particular, as per https://crrev.com/c/5300870, the IDs corresponding

to local-or-syncable nodes are very likely to be reassigned when the

feature flag transitions from disabled to enabled.



This patch introduces the logic to seamlessly migrate the user's

last-saved bookmark folder stored in preferences. To do so, the ID

reassignment mapping needs to be broadcasted to BookmarkClient.



Change-Id: I0b7d21512a01bf5875b9568a583f7d1d5e35f0de

entry.title: [Passwords] Exclude search fields from single username flows.
entry.content:
Most of the miscalssifications made by username first & forgot

password classifier are related to search fields.

Often fields have 'search' label or id attribute, but classifications

are made using signatures, that are based mostly on name attributes,

which are often not meaningful and unique.



This CL makes both parsing form for filling and selecting fields

for voting more conservative, and excludes fields that have 'search'

substring in their name, id or label attributes from consideration.

entry.title: Mark name_to_extension_prefpath as constexpr.
entry.content:
This was actually being initialized at runtime, since the initializer

was not a constant expression. base::MakeFixedFlatMap is stricter and

requiring consteval, so fixing this consists of two parts:

- marking `name_to_extension_prefpath` itself as constexpr

- making all the pref constants as constexpr



Incidentally, this fix also makes the pref name constants actually

constant, as a `const char*` can still be assigned.



Note that using inline constexpr variables has some implications in

component builds: specifically, it is possible for the constants to be

built into multiple discrete components, breaking things that rely on

pointer identity. This dependency does not seem to be there in practice,

and Chrome should prioritize optimizing for production builds that ship

to users over developer-only component builds.

entry.title: Recognize xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx as a credit card number field
entry.content:
This CL extends the regex for credit card number fields to also

recognize placeholders like xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx.



The pattern is wrapped in ^ $, to reduce false positives.

Otherwise any sequence of 16 'x' would be classified as a CC

number. Note, however, that also CreditCardFieldParser::Parse

imposes a bunch of constraints for delivering a CC number.

entry.title: fix: ime: Prevent TSF hang Chromium window when DPI changed
entry.content:
On Windows, TSF is used as a IME provider. When user is using a

non-English IME like Chinese, and after a DPI change when the window is

minimized, typing on any textarea will hang the Chromium window, and by

observation all mouse and keyboard events are gone. This workaround

fixes that problem by re-initializing the IME when DPI is changed, and

shutdown and initialize the TSFBridge every time the window is focused.

It is tested that problem can't be reproduced with same trigger procedure after applying this patch.



Reproduce procedure:

1. Set your computer display DPI ratio to 150%

2. Open a Chromium window with a textarea, for example, https://textarea.online/

3. Type something

4. Minimize the Window (Very Important)

5. Login the session with RDP, expect the DPI changed to 100%

6. Type something, you'll expect the window freeze :)

entry.title: Import `bytemuck@1.14.3` into `third_party/rust`
entry.content:
This CL has been generated semi-automatically through the following

steps:



1. Add `bytemuck = "1"` to `chromium_crates_io/Cargo.toml`

2. Run `tools/crates/run_gnrt.py vendor`

3. Run `tools/crates/run_gnrt.py gen`

4. Run `update_inclusive_language_presubmit_exempt_dirs.sh`

5. Manually edit `audits.toml` with results of a security audit and

verify results via `tools/crates/run_cargo_vet.py check`



Motivation:



* Short-term: We may be able to refactor the `read_fonts` crate to

depend on `bytemuck`. Reusing `bytemuck` may allow limiting or

eliminating usage of `unsafe` in `read_fonts`. (In this case

`bytemuck` is a transitive, indirect dependency of Chromium.)

* Long-term: We may need `bytemuck` as a transitive dependency of the

`png` crate (see also go/rusty-png-ui-gfx-decoder). (In this case

`bytemuck` would still be a transitive, indirect dependency of

Chromium.)

* Long-term: We may need `bytemuck` to implement some low-level pixel

transformations when integrating the `png` crate into Chromium. (See

https://crrev.com/c/4860211/13. In this case `bytemuck` would be a

direct dependency of Chromium - of the C++/Rust glue code needed for

the Chromium integration.)



`unsafe` review comments and other audit notes can be found in

`audits.toml`.



Bug: 328949638

Change-Id: Ifb8ce8b73e577671b5c1329cdd69dfff6c220a26

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5362675

Commit-Queue: Łukasz Anforowicz

entry.title: Prepare to convert SBThreatType to an enum class in /components/blocked_content
entry.content:
It's somewhat difficult to log an SBThreatType as an UMA histogram since

we don't have a kMaxValue. We can't simply add a kMaxValue because

SBThreatType is an enum instead of enum class, and we'd be exposing a

constant safe_browsing::kMaxValue. This CL prepares to convert

SBThreatType to an enum class in /components/blocked_content.



That requires two changes:



- SBThreatType is no longer implicitly convertible to int, so we will

need a few static casts



- SBThreatType values are now in the namespace

safe_browsing::SBThreatType instead of just safe_browsing. In some

places this is fixed by adding the new namespace, and in some places

with a "using enum" declaration. We can't just add a "using enum" for

all usages of SBThreatType because "using enum" would declare a

constant kMaxValue. So "using enum" is only used when many

SBThreatType constants are used, and in as narrow a scope as possible.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: browser-controls: Resize WebContents at animation start
entry.content:
When browser controls are forced to show (e.g. when a navigation

starts), they animate to showing without affecting Blink/web content

layout. Only once the controls become fully shown will Blink's size be

changed to account for the browser controls.



Cross document view transitions grab a snapshot of the outgoing page at

the last possible moment, at navigation commit. This can happen before

the aforementioned resize is issued, meaning the snapshot is captured in

the larger "controls hidden" layout state.



We attempted to solve this by always placing the snapshot containing

block to have its origin behind browser controls so that the larger size

would simply be overlaid by the browser controls. However, if the

snapshot occurs while controls are partially showing, this approach

alone isn't enough:



position: fixed elements in the compositor are offset from their

Blink-known positions by the browser controls. This causes us to

mis-place view-transition elements that are position: fixed.

Additionally any elements whose height dependents on the viewport will

be captured in smaller state, causing a size morph which tends to look

awkward.



This CL forces the controls to shrink the Blink size as soon as the

browser issues the "show controls" signal to the renderer. This will

cause any viewport-dependent heights to resize sooner than they would

today. Otherwise, this shouldn't be user visible: while Blink will see

the size fixed elements in their "smaller viewport" state, the controls

are still hidden (animating to shown), meaning clipping and positioning

are expanded in the compositor.



Note: we do this by forcing on the mControlsResizeView bit in

CompositorViewHolder. However, the state used to compute this value is

unchanged. This means that if the size is recomputed for another reason

before the renderer submits a new frame with updated controls offset it

will reset back to false. This doesn't appear to happen in practice so

this first pass did the simple thing. A more robust approach would be to

track when the renderer has an outstanding "show controls" signal but

I'm not sure it's worth the complexity?



Bug: 41490049

Change-Id: I6129258f9e814364477b1cd51fc8d67562c3a236

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366846

Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

Commit-Queue: David Bokan

entry.title: [ios] Ensure non-incognito tab open when presenting Tips UI
entry.content:
When the user interacts with a Tips notification, a UI flow starting

with a modal view needs to be displayed. These modals can only be

displayed if a non-incognito tab is currently open. This change adds

an ApplicationCommand to ensure that all currently open modals are

closed and that a non-incognito tab is open, to allow the UI flow to

display.

entry.title: Use system colors from color providers to paint
entry.content:
This CL represents the concluding phase in moving system color

definitions to the color pipeline. The CL introduces the

SystemColorFromColorProvider() method in the layout theme, which

retrieves system colors based on CSS value ids from the color provider.



Key changes in this CL include:

1.) The addition of LayoutTheme::SystemColorFromColorProvider()

2.) The removal of the Windows specific LayoutThemeWin::SystemColor()

method

3.) The use of PlatformColorsChanged() and ColorSchemeChanged()

invalidation methods when color providers are updated.



Future work will involve the removal and cleanup of the previous

pipeline, UpdateSystemColorInfo(), which was formerly used to fetch

system colors in the renderer process. This will ultimately lead to the

deprecation of the SystemColorFromNativeTheme() method.



Bug: 1430181

Change-Id: Ie2a05d3f91378879d4a65700108b305ddbdec0f0

entry.title: Use correct fallback colors in highlight painting
entry.content:
Previously, the fallback colors for highlight styles were

computed once per highlight overlay layer, regardless of

whether highlights overlapped or not. As a result, a spelling

error in one part of a text run would paint using colors from

a highlight elsewhere on the run.



Fix this issue by storing styles per highlight part, rather than

layer, and updating the styles as the parts are computed. Text

decoration colors are also stored because they are not part of

TextPaintStyle.



Fixed: 41497157

Change-Id: I295df4bcd82f8a5e886aecb3b35049d7d6645ce0

entry.title: Prepare to convert SBThreatType to an enum class in /components/subresource_filter
entry.content:
It's somewhat difficult to log an SBThreatType as an UMA histogram since

we don't have a kMaxValue. We can't simply add a kMaxValue because

SBThreatType is an enum instead of enum class, and we'd be exposing a

constant safe_browsing::kMaxValue. This CL prepares to convert

SBThreatType to an enum class in /components/subresource_filter.



That requires two changes:



- SBThreatType is no longer implicitly convertible to int, so we will

need a few static casts



- SBThreatType values are now in the namespace

safe_browsing::SBThreatType instead of just safe_browsing. In some

places this is fixed by adding the new namespace, and in some places

with a "using enum" declaration. We can't just add a "using enum" for

all usages of SBThreatType because "using enum" would declare a

constant kMaxValue. So "using enum" is only used when many

SBThreatType constants are used, and in as narrow a scope as possible.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



Bug: 329698341

Change-Id: Ide5b85a22f14e3886e2766630ef318d58fd97d9f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5375397

entry.title: [UNO] Maintain account consistency Pre Chrome Sign in
entry.content:
When explicit browser sign in is enabled and the user is not signed in

to chrome, account consistency works in the following manner:

- First, refresh tokens that do not have a valid counter account in the

cookie are revoked.

- Then if needed, the cookie is updated to remove accounts that do not

have a refresh token. This is possible:

(1) If the user has signed out from chrome layer while being offline.

(2) If an account is moved from a profile to another as part of the

Sign in interception flows or as a result merge sync data flow.



First step has been implemented on previous CLs. This CL implements

the second step to update the accounts in the cookie.



In case the first account in the cookie doesn't have a refresh token,

the reconcilor would only perform a logout if the account is valid to

avoid reordering accounts on the web during an active session. If the

account is invalid, we would rather reorder than logout all accounts.



Bug: b/326205071, b/320279580

Change-Id: Ifb2924e60e85f7f1f783e274b0399c59f74445a8

entry.title: [UNOp2][Android] Improve string management for signin bottom sheet
entry.content:
The new sign-in flow requires to support different bottom sheet

strings sets for the new sign-in entry points, and some bottom sheet

sub views (e.g. subtitle) need to be be hidden for few entry points.



To prepare for the support this behaviour, this CL:

- transforms the `AccountPickerBottomSheetStrings` interface into a

simple DTO, to simplify its use and serialisation for later.

- allows 0 value for strings attached to subviews that can be hidden,

and check for the 0 value to hide the subview.



This CL also updates the default strings used for the new sign-in flow,

and adds related tests for the bookmark manager entry point.

entry.title: Fenced frames: Revoke network access for partition nonce [1/N]
entry.content:
This CL creates an IPC on NetworkContext that is called from window.fence.disableUntrustedNetwork to register a given partition nonce in a new data structure in the NetworkContext, which is later used to deny network access.



Future CLs will make checks against the data structure more robust (e.g., cancel redirects in addition to just failing to start requests),

actually delete nonces that are no longer needed (when the

FencedFrameProperties is destructed), and restore the data structure

upon network service crash/restart.



This CL temporarily moves WPT that exercise

window.fence.disableUntrustedNetwork from external to internal WPT,

because we need to be able to use remote context (which relies on

network access) even after network is revoked. In the medium term

we will do this with a new testdriver API, but adding a testdriver

API requires a process that we don't want to block this CL on.



See this implementation design doc for more context:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JnwuFl84P5jR_9PkpM68WdCD63UerKxWm-v4XXj2sRc/edit#heading=h.bat9awopsp53

separate flag in case we won't ship it in the first release of anchor

positioning. Also put the position-try shorthand behind the same flag

since the shorthand only adds position-try-order to

position-try-options.

When this feature is enabled, the hint is not sent by default, as it is

a high-entropy hint. So, enabling this feature has no impact unless a

site requests the hint.

entry.title: Fix crash during authentication in multiple windows in pwm settings
entry.content:
This CL fixes a crash that happened on Windows if authentication was

started for multiple windows at the same time. The reason for crash was that DeviceAuthenticator::Cancel() is not implemented on Windows.

Thus if authentication is in progress it shouldn't be canceled and the

new authentications will return immediately with result false until the

first one is resolved by the user.



Bug: 327026304

Change-Id: I64e0bd442373f6a4ce0715f16526a995c310c371

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366043

Commit-Queue: Karol Sygiet

Reviewed-by: Viktor Semeniuk

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1274112}

entry.title: [bookmarks] Add BookmarkModel::IsLocalOnlyNode()
entry.content:
The predicate allows distinguishing, in all possible scenarios, whether

or not a bookmark node is a local-only bookmark, meaning that is isn't

getting sync-ed or uploaded to servers.



Although this predicate will get simpler over time, it is currently

difficult to consider all cases outside BookmarkModel, as it is obvious

from this patch.



To be able to implement the desired logic, the pre-existing API in

BookmarkClient that was previously used for metrics only is repurposed

to be used more generally, and specifically exercised inside the new

function.



Bug: 326059401

Change-Id: Ia3b1da0531dcdfb744f2056579d1750be1ad25fd

entry.title: [Viz] Fix TestContextProvider ClientSI creation
entry.content:
TestSharedImageInterface creates ClientSharedImage instances that are

backed by GMBs, and thus it needs to specify the GMB handle type so that

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget() operates correctly. Creation of

ClientSharedImage for a given plane also needs to be passed the format

*for that plane*. This CL makes both corrections.
